title: Foundation Engineering
description:
This is an introductory module in foundation
engineering. The topics covered include site
investigation and interpretation of soil reports,
shallow foundations and deep foundations.
Students will learn how to use simple foundations
to distribute vertical loads from the superstructure
to the underlying soil formation without
overstressing the soil (more complex loading
modes to be discussed in advanced modules).
Students are taught the interpretation of site
investigation report, derivation of relevant design
soil properties, selection of sensible foundation
type, and verification of capacity and settlement
requirements.
